metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45960 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, a left shift by 29 (or more) places in the storeAtts function in xmlparse.c can lead to realloc misbehavior (e.g., allocating too few bytes, or only freeing memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-1
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-1
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!) rodrigo-zaiden> libxmltok does not include nsAttsPower, so, not affected.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-1').
firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
insighttoolkit4 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
